definition: to fight together/to come to blows
mutually/with one another/manservant/boy servant/guy (derog.)
variant of 廝|厮[si1]
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)

sentences.english: Still fighting, the two boys struggled in the water.
sentences.chinese: 两个男孩边厮打，边在水中挣扎。

sentences.english: The dogs were fighting over a pearl.
sentences.chinese: 那些狗在为一块骨头厮打。

sentences.english: But her experience of grappling with foreign powers is slighter than she often implies .
sentences.chinese: 但是，她与外国力量厮打的经验比她经常暗示的要少。
她疯狂而凶猛地厮打著。

sentences.english: There are two guys beating the hell out of each other in the street outside.
sentences.chinese: 有两个家伙在外面的大街上拼命地厮打。

sentences.english: I saw two women fighting on the street.
sentences.chinese: 我看到两个妇女在街上厮打。

sentences.english: They often drank a lot and then they fought each other and beat the children.
sentences.chinese: 他们经常喝很多酒，然后就彼此厮打，揍孩子们。

sentences.english: The dog struggled fiercely with the wild cat.

definition: to wrestle/to grapple/to scuffle
to chase and beat
to shove/to jostle
to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
physical encounter/fight
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to mediate in a quarrel/to intervene in a dispute and try to calm things down
to try to stop a fight/to intervene in a fight
to push and shove
to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
to square off/to exchange blows/to rain blows on sb
to hurl abuse/to trade insults/slanging match
armed (robbery etc)
to tear at (with the teeth, like one animal attacking another)
to attack with a bladed weapon
to hold a knife/knife-wielding
